intro: Tibouchina erioclada, commonly known as the velvetleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue bracts that resemble petals. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture, and its inflorescence consists of clusters of small, white to pink flowers. Tibouchina erioclada is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. It is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
